refnamediv.refpurpose: How to write matrices of doubles in a gateway.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This help describes how matrix of doubles can be handled through the Scilab API.
Two types of functions can be used to write in the memory of Scilab.

refsection.title: Create from existing data
refsection.programlisting: int createMatrixOfDouble(int _iVar, int _iRows, int _iCols, double* _pdblReal) int createComplexMatrixOfDouble(int _iVar, int _iRows, int _iCols, double* _pdblReal, double* _pdblImg)

listitem.para: Position in the Scilab memory where you want to put the variable
Number of rows of the new variable
Numbers of columns of the new variable
This argument does not exist with createMatrixOfDouble.

refsection.title: Write directly in Scilab memory
refsection.programlisting: int allocMatrixOfDouble(int _iVar, int _iRows, int _iCols, double** _pdblReal) int allocComplexMatrixOfDouble(int _iVar, int _iRows, int _iCols, double** _pdblReal, double** _pdblImg)

listitem.para: Position in the Scilab memory where you want to put the variable
Number of rows of the new variable
Numbers of columns of the new variable
Returns address of real data array (size: _iCols * _iRows)
Returns address of imaginary data array (size: _iCols * _iRows)
This argument does not exist with allocMatrixOfDouble.
